alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 25 at 6:41PM EDT until March 27 at 12:41AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following creeks and river, and locations, in Indiana... Mill Creek near Cataract. Sugar Creek near Edinburgh. Mississinewa River near Ridgeville. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Buck Creek at Acton. Youngs Creek at Amity. .Widespread rainfall of 2 to nearly 5 inches has resulted in widespread lowland flooding along the Wabash, White, and East Fork White Rivers, along with numerous smaller tributaries. These smaller tributaries will drop back below flood within the next few days. Water continues to rise in many locations on main stem rivers, however, and crests in some areas, particularly along lower reaches of the White and Wabash, will not arrive for several days. Moderate flooding is expected in a small number of locations. Flooding will likely last for a week or more in some areas. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Youngs Creek at Amity. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Significant flooding in progress. Parks and some local roads are flooded by a foot or more of water. Agricultural flooding is noticeable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:15 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 10.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:15 PM EDT Saturday was 10.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.2 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
